Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, a fundamental human right and cornerstone of democracy.
There is a risk of the government suppressing legitimate political dissent by labeling it as misinformation.
The legislation could be used to restrict public debate and enforce ideological conformity.
Truth should not be determined by the government, as it does not have a monopoly on truth.
The legislation could lead to a situation where dissenting opinions are penalized, akin to authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: The United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights gives all humans the right of free speech.
If the Government or its bureaucracy is given the power to enforce their own political views and penalize anyone who gives a different opinion then free speech in our country no longer exists.
Truth is absolute. Postmodern relativism says that I can have my truth and you can have your truth and we can both be right. Unfortunately this is impossible.
